meanings.definition: To mix or knead into a paste.
meanings.sent1: She decided to impaste the ingredients together to make a delicious dough.
meanings.sent2: The chef will impaste the spices to create a flavorful marinade.
meanings.sent3: As she tried to impaste the play dough, it ended up sticking to her hands more than the bowl.
meanings.sent4: The artist's emotions impaste with the colors on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: He impasted the memories of his childhood into his storytelling, making it more vivid.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat with paste.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to impaste the paper cutouts onto the poster.
meanings.sent2: She will impaste the wallpaper on the wall to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to impaste its paws with glue while playing with the craft supplies.
meanings.sent4: The fog impasted the windows, making it hard to see outside.
meanings.sent5: The chef decided to impaste the cake with a layer of frosting for a sweeter taste.

meanings.definition: A mixture of flour and water used in painting.
meanings.sent1: The artist prepared the impaste before starting the oil painting.
meanings.sent2: She used the impaste to add texture to her artwork.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child mistook the impaste for actual dough and tried to take a bite.
meanings.sent4: The impaste on the palette mixed beautifully with the vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The impaste dried quickly, allowing the artist to layer colors on top smoothly.
